meanings.definition: To calculate the total of something again.
meanings.sent1: She retotals the grocery bill to make sure it is correct.
meanings.sent2: He always retotals his exam scores to avoid mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The accountant retotals the expenses with a smile, finding a small error.
meanings.sent4: Her mind retotals the memories of that special day, trying to relive the joy.
meanings.sent5: The machine retotals the measurements with precision, ensuring accuracy.

meanings.definition: The act of recalculating a total.
meanings.sent1: The retotals of the sales figures revealed a discrepancy.
meanings.sent2: She keeps a record of all retotals done in the office.
meanings.sent3: The retotals of the votes caused a stir among the candidates.
meanings.sent4: His retotals of the budget numbers shed light on overspending.
meanings.sent5: The retotals of the inventory showed a shortage of supplies.
